Class AbstractDatumType

Namespace
NDSH.Geospatial.Gml.Coordinate.Datums
Assembly
NDSH.Geospatial.Metadata.ISO19115.Ed2003.dll

The AbstractDatumType specifies the relationship of a coordinate system to the earth, thus creating a coordinate reference system. A datum uses a parameter or set of parameters that determine the location of the origin of the coordinate reference system. Each datum subtype may be associated with only specific types of coordinate systems. This abstract complex type shall not be used, extended, or restricted, in a GML Application Schema, to define a concrete subtype with a meaning equivalent to a concrete subtype specified in this document.

[IsoType("AbstractDatumType", WrapperName = "DatumPropertyType", IsAbstract = true, IsoType = IsoTypes.ComplexType)]
[JsonObject("AbstractDatumType")]
public abstract class AbstractDatumType : IdentifiedObjectType, IModel, IObservableModel, INotifyPropertyChanged, IDbId, IStandardObjectProperties, IId, ITypeAssociated

Properties

AnchorDefinition

Gets/Sets the definition of the anchor point used to define the datum.

The AnchorDefinition is a description, possibly including coordinates, of the definition used to anchor the datum to the Earth. Also known as the "origin", especially for engineering and image datums. The CodeSpace attribute may be used to reference a source of more detailed on this point or surface, or on a set of such descriptions.

  • Geodetic Datum This point is also known as the fundamental point, which is traditionally the point where the relationship between geoid and ellipsoid is defined. In some cases, the "fundamental point" may consist of a number of points. In those cases, the parameters defining the geoid/ellipsoid relationship have been averaged for these points, and the averages adopted as the datum definition.
  • Engineering Datum The anchor definition may be a physical point, or it may be a point with defined coordinates in another coordinate reference system.
  • Image Datum The anchor definition is usually either the centre of the image or the corner of the image.
  • Temporal Datum This attribute is not defined. Instead of the anchor definition, a temporal datum carries a separate time origin of type DateTime. 
[JsonProperty("anchorDefinition", Order = 2)]
public virtual CodeType? AnchorDefinition { get; set; }

Property Value

CodeType

DomainOfValidity

Gets/Sets an association role to an EX_Extent_Type object as encoded in ISO/TS 19139, either referencing or containing the definition of that extent.
